com.matrix

Interface MatrixInterface<T extends java.lang.Number>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DoubleMatrix, IntegerMatrix, Matrix

      • getRows

        int getRows()
        Returns:
        int The number of rows in the Matrix.

      • getCols

        int getCols()
        Returns:
        int The number of columns in the Matrix.

      • setAtIndex

        void setAtIndex(int row,
                int col,
                T value)
         throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets the index at [row][column] to be the value passed. Implementing classes should do checks to make sure the row and col values are valid.
        Parameters:
        row - The row at which to place the value.
        col - The col at which to place the value.
        value - The value to be set at that location.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • getAtIndex

        T getAtIndex(int row,
             int col)
      throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the value from the corresponding index. Implementing classes should check that the row and column are valid.
        Parameters:
        row - Row from which to get the value.
        col - Col from which to get the value.
        Returns:
        int Value from the corresponding row, column pair.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • add

        Matrix<T> add(Matrix<T> arg0)
        Add two matrices together. Implementing classes should check for the validity of the operation.
        Parameters:
        other - The matrix to add to the calling matrix.
        Returns:
        Matrix The resulting matrix after the addition.

      • subtract

        Matrix<T> subtract(Matrix<T> arg0)
        Subtract one matrix from the other. Implementing classes should check for the validity of the operation.
        Parameters:
        other - The matrix to subtract from the calling matrix.
        Returns:
        Matrix The resulting matrix after the subtraction.

      • multiply

        Matrix<T> multiply(int scalar)
        Multiply the contents of the calling matrix by the value passed in.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to scale the contents of the matrix by.
        Returns:
        Matrix The resulting matrix after the scaling.

      • multiply

        Matrix<T> multiply(Matrix<T> arg0)
        Multiply two matrices together. Implementing classes should check for the validity of the operation.
        Parameters:
        other - The matrix to multiply to the calling matrix.
        Returns:
        Matrix The resulting matrix after the multiplication.

      • transpose

        Matrix<T> transpose()
        Transpose the calling matrix.
        Returns:
        Matrix The resulting matrix after transposition.

      • compareTo

        int compareTo(Matrix<T> other)
        Compare two matrices together and return an integer to signify their difference.
        Parameters:
        other - The matrix to compare against the calling matrix.
        Returns:
        int The result of the comparison.

      • equals

        boolean equals(Matrix<T> other)
        Determine if two matrices are equal to one another.
        Parameters:
        other - The matrix to check equality against the calling matrix.
        Returns:
        boolean True or false depending on the equality of the matrices.

        Overrides:
